This 9-question screening test can help determine whether you might have signs or symptoms of depression. Use the results to decide if you need to see a doctor or other mental health professional to further discuss diagnosis and treatment of depression.
Instructions: Answer the following questions as they relate to the previous 2 weeks. Rate how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems over the last two weeks.
Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Feeling tired or having little energy
Feeling bad about yourself - or that you are a failur or have let yourself or your family down
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual
Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some way
How often do you have a drink containing alcohol?
How many drinks containing alcohol do you have on a typical day when you are drinking?
How often do you have six or more drinks on one occasion?
How often during the last year have you found that you were not able to stop drinking once you had started?
How often during the last year have you failed to do what was normally expected from you because of drinking?
How often during the last year have you needed a first drink in the morning to get yourself going after a heavy drinking session?
How often during the last year have you had a feeling of guilt or remorse after drinking?
How often during the last year have you been unable to remember what happened the night before because you had been drinking?
Have you or someone else been injured as a result of your drinking?
Has a relative or friend or a doctor or another health worker been concerned about your drinking or suggested you cut down?
Are there any legal matters in your life that are causing concern for you or your family?
Do engage in arguments about finances with those close to you?
Do you find yourself worrying about finances more than 4 times a week?
Are considering buying, refinancing, or selling a home anytime in the near future?
Have you had a hard time doing your work because of your personal problems?
Do you feel sad, unhappy, or low for most of the day nearly every day?
Do you experience extreme unease and/or worry about many situations and experiences?
Have you found that you have not been able to do what was normally expected of you because of your drinking or other drugs?
Do you and your partner have a great deal of difficulty when it comes to communicating and solving problems together?
Do you at times struggle to find appropriate child care for your children?
Do you participate in the care for any elderly family members either living with you or living at another location?
My partner and I are able to communicate with respect and not harshly.
When I am alone with my partner I am relaxed and comfortable.
My partner is there for me during difficult times.
If we come to an issue upon which we do not agree, I am optimistic we will work out an agreeable solution.
My partner treats me with care and tenderness.
We have activities and friends outside the relationship.
We have a lot of passion in our relationship.
My partner likes to share his or her thoughts.
Yes, but not in the last year

string-array.name: arrays_reminder_questions
string-array.item: What is your mother\'s maiden name?
What was your first pet\'s name?
What is the name of the city you were born in?
What is the name of the high school you graduated from?

string-array.name: quiz_questions_arrays
string-array.item: I exercise to the point of perspiration at least twice a week
I have at least 1 person who lives nearby from whom I can ask a favour
I eat at least one hot, balanced meal a day
I drink fewer than two cups of coffee (or tea or cola) a day

Your assessment results indicate that you may be at risk for harming yourself or someone else. Please call 911 or go immediately to the nearest hospital emergency room. You can also contact your EAP at 800–433–2320 or call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1–800–273–TALK ( 1–800–273–8255).
EAP counselors are available by telephone 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, including holidays.

This 11-question screening test can help determine health of your current relationship. You can use the results to decide if you need to seek assistance to address any issues within your relationship.
Instructions: Please choose the answer that bests relates to your opinion about your relationship.
This quick 12 question LifePilot assessment will help you determine what EAP services you need.
Fill out the following questions truthfully. At the end of the questionnaire you will receive a recommendation on what EAP services might be useful to you.
Overhelmed with your choice of services? Not sure where to start? Wonder if you are missing an EAP benefit that might be useful?

This 10-question screening test can help determine whether you might have problems with drinking alcohol. Use the results to decide if you need to see a doctor or other mental health professional to further discuss diagnosis and treatment of alcohol abuse, dependence or addiction.
Instructions: The 10 items below refer to how you have behaved during the past year. For each item, indicate the statement that is most true for you, by checking the appropriate box next to the item.

Your screen results indicate that you have few or no symptoms of depression. 

Please click here for additional information on Depression. 

Please call your EAP, Cascade Centers, with any questions. 800–433–2320 

Remember, this is NOT a diagnosis. This screen is not designed to provide a comprehensive assessment or diagnosis of depression. Only a doctor or qualified mental health professional can make a diagnosis of any type of depression and recommend treatments.

Mild depression 

Your screen results are consistent with minimal symptoms of depression. If these symptoms are distressing to you or are distracting you at work, or home, you may benefit from seeing a counselor through your EAP or your physician for a complete evaluation. 

Please click here for additional information on Depression. 

Please call your EAP, Cascade Centers, with any questions. 800–433–2320 

Remember, this is NOT a diagnosis. Only a doctor or qualified mental health professional can make a diagnosis of any type of depression and recommend treatments.

Moderate depression 

Your screen results are consistent with moderate symptoms of depression. If these symptoms are distressing to you or are distracting you at work, or home, you may benefit from seeing a counselor through your EAP or your physician for a complete evaluation, as soon as practical. 

Please click here for additional information on Depression. 

Please call your EAP, Cascade Centers, with any questions. 800–433–2320 

Remember, this is NOT a diagnosis. Only a doctor or qualified mental health professional can make a diagnosis of any type of depression and recommend treatments.

Moderately severe depression 

Your screen results are consistent with many of the symptoms of depression. You are advised to see your physician or contact Cascade EAP immediately for a complete assessment. Although many individuals cope well with symptoms like yours, effective treatments for depression are available to help reduce your symptoms and improve your quality of life. A mental health professional or your physician can advise you about whether you can benefit from treatment and describe different treatment alternatives. 

Please click here for additional information on Depression. 

Please call your EAP, Cascade Centers, with any questions. 800–433–2320 

Remember, this is NOT a diagnosis. Only a doctor or qualified mental health professional can make a diagnosis of any type of depression and recommend treatments.

Severe depression 

Your screen results are consistent with many of the symptoms of depression. You are advised to see your physician or contact Cascade EAP immediately for a complete assessment. Although many individuals cope well with symptoms like yours, effective treatments for depression are available to help reduce your symptoms and improve your quality of life. A mental health professional or your physician can advise you about whether you can benefit from treatment and describe different treatment alternatives. 

Please click here for additional information on Depression. 

Please call your EAP, Cascade Centers, with any questions. 800–433–2320 

Remember, this is NOT a diagnosis. Only a doctor or qualified mental health professional can make a diagnosis of any type of depression and recommend treatments.

Your score indicates that your relationship may be in need of some professional assistance. According to your answers there are some significant issues that need to be addressed in your relationship. Your Employee Assistance Program can help you develop some effective tools for dealing with your problems and create healthier new patterns. Please contact us for recommendations. 

Please click here for additional information on relationships. 

Please note that this is NOT a diagnosis. Only a doctor or qualified mental health professional can make a diagnosis of any type and recommend treatments.

Your score indicates that in general your sense of satisfaction in your relationship is solid. But it appears that there may be some areas that can be improved on such as communication, appreciation, and support. Such difficulties can be common in most relationships. But if they have been continuing for years or getting worse you may want to consider seeking out counseling. Your Employee Assistance Program can help you develop some effective tools for dealing with your problems and create healthier new patterns. Please contact us for recommendations. 

Your Employee Assistance Program can help you develop some effective tools for dealing with your problems and create healthier new patterns. Please contact us for recommendations. 

Please click here for additional information on relationships. 

Please note that this is NOT a diagnosis. Only a doctor or qualified mental health professional can make a diagnosis of any type and recommend treatments.

Your score indicates that you have a strong sense of satisfaction in your relationship. Congratulations! According to the manner in which you answered the questions on this assessment your relationship appears to be stable and healthy. Although you may occasionally experience a bump or two, you and your significant other appear to be able to expertly navigate these waters. 

Please click here for additional information on relationships. 

Please note that this is NOT a diagnosis. Only a doctor or qualified mental health professional can make a diagnosis of any type and recommend treatments.

You are in the low–risk range. 

Remember, this is NOT a diagnosis. Only a doctor or qualified mental health professional can make a diagnosis of any type of addiction or drinking problem and recommend treatments. 

NOTE: If you suspect that you have a drinking or drug problem, you should seek help from a doctor or the EAP counselor regardless of how you score on this screening test. 

Please call your EAP, Cascade Centers, with any questions. 800–433–2320

Your score indicates that you may have an alcohol problem and/or are engaging in harmful drinking. 

Keep in mind, help is available and there are many different treatments for alcoholism and alcohol abuse available. Please share your AUDIT Score with your EAP counselor or physician. 

Remember, this is NOT a diagnosis. Only a doctor or qualified mental health professional can make a diagnosis of any type of addiction or drinking problem and recommend treatments. 

NOTE: If you suspect that you have a drinking or drug problem, you should seek help from a doctor or mental health professional regardless of how you score on this screening test. 

Please call your EAP, Cascade Centers, with any questions. 800–433–2320

Your results indicate that you might not be in need of a specific EAP service at this time. Please feel free to contact us with any questions. \n\nRemember the EAP is always available for any concern including general resource retrieval. We have counselors available 24 hour a day, 7 days a week to take your call.
Your LifePilot score suggests that the following EAP services could be helpful for you:
Please click on the links below to learn more about the recommended services.

Problem Identification, assessment, and establishment of outcome goals
An initial 30 minute office or telephone consultation with 25% discount thereafter
Assistance with childcare, education issues, behavioral difficulties, development concerns, and adoption information from newborns to the age of 18.

Assistance in finding solutions to the aging needs of older adults and the family members caring for them such as housing, alternative living, home health, community services, legal concerns and medical issues.
Up to a 60-minute free consultation with a highly trained Fraud Resolution Specialist™ (FRS).
Vetted information and resource retrieval services.
The Enhanced Benefit Group Home Ownership Program offered by Cascade Centers EAP can help employees with even greater savings to make your dreams of home ownership more affordable than ever.
Access to wellness coaches, online tool, activity tracking, discounts, and more.

Counseling

The Employee Assistance Program (EAP) is a FREE and CONFIDENTIAL benefit that can assist employees and their eligible family members with any personal problems, large or small. Cascade offers face to face, phone sessions, or live video conference for problem identification, assessment, establishing outcome goals, recommendations, priorities and actions needed to reach goals. For example, you can receive assistance with concerns such as relationships, martial, family, depression, anxiety, and stress.

Contact Cascade at 1–800–433–2320 for a counseling.

Crisis Support

Masters level counselors are available 24/7 and immediately available for all callers.

Call 1–800–433–2320

Legal

Employees and family members may receive one initial thirty-minute office or telephone consultation per separate legal matter (up to three per year) at no cost with a network attorney. If the member decides to retain the participating attorney after the initial consultation, the member will be provided with a preferred rate reduction of 25% from the attorneyâ€™s normal hourly rate.

Information and assistance is available for the following:

  • Civil Matters
  • Consumer-Related Issues
  • Personal and Family
  • Business Concerns
  • IRS Matters
  • Income Tax Preparation
  • Wills and Estate Planning
  • Real Estate

Contact Cascade at 1–800–433–2320 for a legal consultation.

Financial Coaching

Each covered member is eligible for 30 days of unlimited financial coaching at no-cost. Services are available for a variety of financial concerns and are provided by a network financial counselor. Coaches provide a needs analysis and online written action plan to help members achieve financial goals. Services are provided by experienced financial professionals and licensed CPAâ€™s. Additional financial coaching is available at a discounted rate.

Financial coaches can help you:

  • Get out of Debt
  • Provide a Credit Analysis
  • Help develop a spending plan
  • Assist with retirement planning
  • Help you understand home buying or refinancing strategies
  • Assist with other money topics

Contact Cascade at 1–800–433–2320 for a financial consultation.

Childcare

Cascade provides assistance in finding solutions for childcare and education resources for your children.

Child Care
  • Infant, Preschool and School Age 
  • In-Home Child Care 
  • Day Care Homes and Centers 
  • Emergency/Back-up Care 
  • Before/After-School Care
  • Weekend/Shift Work Schedules 
  • Care for Special Needs Children
  • Summer Camps 
  • Tip Sheets and Articles


Education
  • Preschools
  • Private/Public Schools
  • After-School Programs
  • School Age Tip Sheets
  • Educational Consultants
  • College Bibliography
  • The College Process
  • Test Preparation
  • Financial Aid Resources
  • Private/Public/Community Colleges

To access this service, please contact Cascade at 1–800–433–2320

Eldercare

Cascade provides assistance in finding solutions to the aging needs of your family

  • Health Care Options
  • Hospitals and Skilled Nursing
  • Transitional and Long-Term Care
  • Veterans and Rehabilitation Hospitals
  • Mail-Order Pharmacies
  • Living Concerns
  • Retirement Communities
  • Assisted and Independent Living
  • Alzheimerâ€™s Facilities

To access this service, please contact Cascade at 1–800–433–2320

Identity Theft Services

Employees and family members receive up to a 60-minute free consultation with a highly trained Fraud Resolution Specialist™ (FRS). The FRS will conduct emergency response activities and assist members with restoring their identity, good credit and with the costly steps to dispute fraudulent debts, etc. Members also receive an Emergency Response Kit outlining actions and suggestions regarding Identity Theft Prevention and Restoration of the member’s damaged identity.

Consultation includes:
  • Guidance immediately after discovery of the identity theft.
  • How to manage and contact credit accounts, ATM cards, checks, etc.
  • Forms to chart the steps you have taken in reporting the identity theft.
  • Assistance in resolving credit problems: credit reports, credit cards, electronic funds transfers, etc.
  • Assistance with specific problems: bank fraud, bankruptcy fraud, criminal violations, fake driver’s license, investment fraud, mail theft, passport fraud, phone fraud, social security number theft and  misuse, tax fraud.
  • Information on the applicable laws.
  • Provide written packet of information on Identity Theft: “When bad things happen to your good name.”

To access this service, please contact Cascade at 1–800–433–2320

Resource Retrieval

Cascade offers information and resource retrieval services for todayâ€™s busy people. From dry-cleaners to dog-sitters, we help time-pressed employees and their families. We find you the information you need within two business-days of the call. This service saves you time by identifying, researching, and verifying information and resources for you.

To access this service, please contact Cascade at 1–800–433–2320

Homeownership

he Enhanced Benefit Group Home Ownership Program offered by Cascade Centers EAP can help employees with even greater savings to make your dreams of home ownership more affordable than ever.


This is a NO COST, NO OBLIGATION program where you can receive FREE consultations in using this service and also take advantage of the substantial savings when you are looking to buy, sell, or refinance your home.

  • Available to friends and family
  • Nationwide service

Some of the discounted services available in our "one stop shopping" network include:

  • Over 200 loan programs
  • Real estate representation
  • Moving Services

To access this service, please contact Cascade at 866–505–3244

Personal Wellness

Through Cascade EAP, you have immediate access to professional health coaches who provide unlimited solution-focused health and wellness coaching, and referrals to local resources. You can receive on-going coaching, support, and information from a healthcare professional.

Areas include:

  • Weight Management
  • Smoking Cessation
  • Stress Management
  • Nutrition & Healthy Cooking
  • Pre & Post Natal Care
  • Self- Care of Chronic Conditions

To get started with a health coach call Cascade EAP at 1–800–433–2320
